bibl.title: Letter from C.C. Pierce to Henry Rose Carter, December 28, 1921

div1.p: Pierce thanks Carter for his paper on yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from C.C. Pierce to Henry Rose Carter, December 28, 1921
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
Division of Venereal Diseases
Institute
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
December 28, 1921.
Dr. H. K. Carter,
U.S. Public Health Service,
2121 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
The Public Health Service thanks you for preparing
the statements on “Prophylaxis of Yellow Fever; and Malaria
Control”.

Inclosed are mimeigraphed copies edited by the addi-
tion of one or more headings. Will you kindly look them over
critically at once, and if there are any errors that should be
rectified advise by return mail?

We appreciate the care that has been exercised in
the preparation of these statements on the various lecture
subjects of the Public Health Institutes. They will serve
a very useful purpose. You will be interested to know that
numerous requests have already been received from lecturers
for copies.
By direction of the Surgeon General.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, C C Pierce
Assistant Surgeon General. HHM:EMW
Incls.
